byline.original: By RACHEL DONADIO and NIKI KITSANTONIS
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London.

abstract: Greek lawmakers give their final approval to raft of tough new austerity measures, taking critical step toward securing crucial foreign aid and averting default; measures are passed day after violent demonstrations against government cutbacks, in which demonstrators battled not only police but also turned against one another.
snippet: Wage cuts, pension cuts, layoffs for public sector workers and changes to collective bargaining rules were among the measures approved by Greek lawmakers.
lead_paragraph: Wage cuts, pension cuts, layoffs for public sector workers and changes to collective bargaining rules were among the measures approved by Greek lawmakers.

headline.main: Amid Protests, Greece Adopts New Austerity Plan
headline.print_headline: Amid Protests, Greece Adopts New Austerity Plan
